rules: Rule1: If a researcher detects contamination in a water sample, then the research field makes a breakthrough in renewable energy
Rule2: If a researcher identifies contamination in a soil sample, then the research field makes a breakthrough in renewable energy
Rule3: If the regulator confirms the safety of the material, then the committee does not halt the research project
Rule4: Either the regulator confirms the safety of the material or a third party verifies the safety of the material
Rule5: If the committee requires approval for the procedure, then should a third party verify the safety of the material, the committee does not halt the research project
Rule6: Either the committee grants a waiver for the regulation or the committee requires approval for the procedure
Rule7: Either the team violates safety protocol or if a scientist discovers perovskite material, then the research field makes a breakthrough in renewable energy
Rule8: If the committee conducts an audit of the laboratory, then the team does not violate safety protocol
Rule9: Either the committee conducts an audit of the laboratory or the regulator performs an inspection of the facility
Rule10: If the regulator performs an inspection of the facility, then the team does not violate safety protocol

Rule11: Either the research institute develops solar panel technology or if the research field does not make a breakthrough in renewable energy, then the research institute receives funding from the government
Rule12: If the product enters the market industry, then the technology achieves commercialization in the market
Rule13: Either the technology faces opposition from competitors or if the product gains approval from the regulatory body, then the product enters the market industry
Rule14: Either the material shows toxicity to the environment or the committee does not halt the research project
Rule15: If the material passes standardized testing, then the material does not show toxicity to the environment
Rule16: If the laboratory completes analysis of the material, then the material passes standardized testing
Rule17: Either the laboratory completes analysis of the material or the consultant submits a report of findings
Rule18: If the consultant submits a report of findings, then the material passes standardized testing
Rule19: If the material causes concern due to its properties, then the material demonstrates hazardous characteristics
Rule20: If the material demonstrates hazardous characteristics, then the material poses risk in its application
Rule21: If the material demonstrates hazardous characteristics, then the material does not pose risk in its application
Rule22: If a scientist discovers perovskite material, then the scientist publishes a paper in a scientific journal
Rule23: Either a scientist discovers perovskite material or the research institute develops wind turbine technology
Rule24: If the research institute develops wind turbine technology, then the research field makes a breakthrough in renewable energy
Rule25: If the scientist publishes a paper in a scientific journal, then the research field makes a breakthrough in renewable energy
Rule26: If the research institute secures a patent for battery design, then the research field makes a breakthrough in renewable energy
Rule27: Either the research institute secures a patent for battery design or the research institute forms a partnership with a tech corporation
Rule28: If the research institute forms a partnership with a tech corporation, then the product gains approval from the regulatory body
Rule29: If the research institute forms a partnership with a tech corporation, then the manufacturer scales production of the technology
Rule30: If the technology achieves commercialization in the market, then the research field makes a breakthrough in renewable energy
Rule31: If the manufacturer scales production of the technology, then the technology achieves commercialization in the market
Rule32: If neither a researcher detects contamination in a water sample nor a researcher identifies contamination in a soil sample, then the committee halts the research project

Rule33: If it is not the case that when the material exhibits stability under various conditions then the committee does not halt the research project, then the material causes concern due to its properties
Rule34: If the research field does not make a breakthrough in renewable energy, then the research institute does not receive funding from the government
facts: Fact1: The material exhibits stability under various conditions
Fact2: The committee does not grant a waiver for the regulation
Fact3: The research institute does not develop solar panel technology
Fact4: The technology does not face opposition from competitors

question: The research field makes a breakthrough in renewable energy
